creator: h.billee

title: "Forced" FireFox Updates
content:
Managing thousands of FIreFox Instances on Windows 10 systems across our enterprise. Need "Polices, Settings" to apply to firefox (GPO, Intune) to "force" updates for all Firefox Versions to latest version and maintain latest version for instances as they are released. Currently, Firefox, Prompts end users if they want to update which is normaly dismissed and the instance remains outdated. In addition, Windows UAC prompts for elevation, which some users do not have rights or the user chooses to not allow. Either case Firefox does not update and remains outdated and vulnerable.

Chrome and Edge browsers all support regular "Forced" update cycles (weekly). Looking for similar service\polices for Firefox to ensure all systems are always running the latest Versions.
creator: david.chichester

title: How to select PDF viewer to use when a PDF is saved locally and accessed with "file://" URL
content:
Greetings, and thank you for taking the time to read my request for help. I use Firefox to view the electronic evidence folders of my Social Security disability clients, which are made available in a web-page-based format with relative links to the documents that are saved in PDF format in the downloaded electronic folder. Each of the exhibits on the exhibit list or case documents with a URL that begins with "file://".

My problem is that Firefox now insists on opening the PDF files in my clients' electronic folders using its internal viewer and not Adobe Acrobat EVEN THOUGH I have gone to Settings->Applications and configured all PDF and TIFF file types to open in Adobe Acrobat DC (Please see screenshot below). This is annoying to say the least because I frequently need to run Adobe Acrobat's OCR on the medical records in my clients' electronic folders so that I can copy text to paste into notes or documents and because I need Adobe Acrobat's ability to take snapshots of portions of the exhibits to paste into documents or notes.

What is odd about this issue is that if I download a PDF from a website with a "http://" or "https://" URL, Firefox _WILL_ open up that PDF in Adobe Acrobat DC per the configurations in the Settings->Applications section.

The first uploaded image shows the settings in the Applications section of Settings. The second uploaded image is an example if Firefox opening a PDF document using its internal viewer in spite of the settings in the Settings->Applications section.

Any help in rectifying this issue would be very much appreciated.

Many thanks, Will Snyder
creator: jwsnyder

title: Firefox doesn't display webpages properly all of a sudden
content:
Suddenly a few weeks ago Firefox stopped displaying websites appropriately. It doesn't draw all the colors and icons so you can see them. My gmail and calendar are b&w mostly and impossible to use as the key icons for clicking on are the same color as the background. See images below of a new email composition using Firefox and chrome - can't minimize or close window in Firefox. I followed all these steps as best I could and nothing. This seems too hard a fix for it suddenly not working - feels like a s/w upgrade issue. I'm now a Chrome user after many years of Firefox. Last attempt here. Suggestions welcome.

Table of Contents 

   DONE Clear the cookies and cache    DONE Reset Zoom    DONE  Reset the minimum font size    DONE Reset the page style    I THINK DONE? HARD TO UNDERSTAND Check that JavaScript is not blocked    DONE Check that your system clock is set correctly    DONE Disable problematic extensions or hardware acceleration    N/A it's most webpages - Report the website   * Also uninstalled Firefox and reinstalled.

So, "How can [you] help?" You can help by providing me with a solution, fix, or guidance by which web pages will appear normally or a method by which I could revert to Firefox pre-91 software. It's impossible to use Firefox as it is now and so I downloaded Microsoft Edge which will have to do for now. Thank you for paying attention to my issue. Marty.

title: Get userChrome.css to only activate customisations when the sidebar is displaying Tree Style Tab.
content:
Since I have the Tree Style Tab extension, I put this code in my userChrome.css to remove the tab strip on the top: ``` /* Hide tab strip but keep space for window buttons */

  1. main-window[tabsintitlebar="true"]:not([extradragspace="true"]) #TabsToolbar > .toolbar-items { 
   opacity: 0;    pointer-events: none;

}

  1. main-window:not([tabsintitlebar="true"]) #TabsToolbar { 
   visibility: collapse !important;

} .tab { 

   margin-left: 1px;    margin-right: 1px;

}

root { 
   --tab-toolbar-navbar-overlap: 0px !important; /* fix for full screen mode */    --tab-min-height: 25px !important;

}

root #tabbrowser-tabs { 
   --tab-min-height: 25px !important;

}

  1. TabsToolbar { 
   height: var(--tab-min-height) !important;

} @media (prefers-color-scheme: dark) { 

   #TabsToolbar {        background-color: #2B2A33 !important;    }

} @media (prefers-color-scheme: light) { 

   #TabsToolbar {        background-color: #F9F9FB !important;    }

}

  1. TabsToolbar[inFullscreen="true"] { /* Do not display window buttons space in full screen */ 
   display:none!important;

} ``` Is there any way to make this block of code to only be activated when the sidebar is on Tree Style Tab? Something like the `#TabsToolbar[inFullscreen="true"]`. Because I can't navigate through tabs if the sidebar is on (for example) bookmarks, or switched off.

title: Linkki avautuu vain yksityiseen ikkunaan ?

Svustolla: https://www.mtvuutiset.fi/ olevat linkit eivät avaudu normaalisti, vaan pitää valita "Avaa uuteen yksityiseen ikkunaan" Tämä tuli alkuvuodesta, kun Firefox päivittyi versioon jota en nyt enää muista. Nyt on käytössä Linux Mint 19.3 Mate työpöydällä ja Firefox 91.0.1.

Samoin vasta uudistuneelle sivustolle, joka ennen uudistusta toimi, pitää myös olla yksityisessä tilassa että toimii. Nyt näkyy vain musta ruutu, jossa lukee "Lataa sovellusta" https://ekassa.proliitto.fi/

Chromium selaimella ei kyseistä ongelmaa ole, mutta en haluaisi sitä käyttää. Onko mitää lääkettä?

title: How does ESR 78 update?
content:
Hello Guys,

How does the browser update on ESR channel? We currently use version 78. I've checked about:config and could not find "app.update.background.enabled"

We use this in an enterpise environment, meaning users can't update or install anything on their machines.

According to: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/firefox-esr-release-cycle

It updates via "the application update service". But what this service is, is not described.

Cheers,

Abdel

title: Lentitud de carga páginas Google "esperando a fonts.googleapis.com"
content:
Hola, al actualizar a la versión 90, me dí cuenta que el navegador dejó de cargar las páginas de servicio de Google (Gmail, Youtube, etc).

Volví a la versión 89 y se solucionó, y estuve esperando a que sacasen actualizaciones para ver si se corregía el problema.

He instalado la versión 91, y parece que ya carga los servicios, pero me he dado cuenta de que hay determinadas páginas que se ralentiza el proceso y en la barra aparece este mensaje "esperando a fonts.googleapis.com"

Finalmente, carga las páginas, pero tras una demora de unos 20 o 30 segundos, y hay servicios como Google Street Maps, que directamente siguen sin funcionar bien.

¿Alguna idea de cómo solucionarlo?
